element.name: Laserllama’s Alternate Ranger Expanded
element.description: A Multitude of Additional Options for the Alternate Ranger

description.p: Prerequisite: 6th-level ranger

You have learned to survive and thrive in frozen tundra. You, and a number of friendly creatures of your choice equal to your proficiency bonus, have advantage on saving throws to resist the negative effects of arctic environments.
In addition, you have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to find food and water in arctic environments.

sheet.description: You, and up to {{proficiency}} friendly creatures of your choice, have advantage on saving throws to resist the negative effects of arctic environments. You have advantage on Survival checks to find food and water in arctic environments.

description.p: Prerequisite: 6th-level ranger

You have learned to survive in scorching desert wastelands. You, and a number of friendly creatures of your choice equal to your proficiency bonus, have advantage on saving throws to resist the negative effects of arid desert environments
In addition, you have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to find food and water in arid deserts.

sheet.description: You, and up to {{proficiency}} friendly creatures of your choice, have advantage on saving throws to resist the negative effects of arid desert environments. You have advantage on Survival checks to find food and water in arid desert environments.

description.p: Prerequisite: 6th-level ranger

You are especially deadly in martial combat. When you score a critical hit with a weapon attack against a creature, you have advantage on the next attack you make against that creature before the end of your next turn.

sheet.description: When you score a critical hit with a weapon attack against a creature, you have advantage on the next attack you make against that creature before the end of your next turn.

description.p: Prerequisite: 14th-level ranger, Fell Handed I
When you score a critical hit against a creature, your critical hit range against that creature expands by 1.
For example, after you score a critical hit against a creature for the first time, you now score a critical hit against that creature on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.

sheet.description: When you score a critical hit against a creature, your critical hit range against that creature expands by 1.

description.p: You have trained to ride animals that will take a rider. You have advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks to control your mount, and mounting or dismounting only costs you 5 feet of your movement, in place of half.

sheet.description: You have advantage on Animal Handling checks to control your mount, and mounting or dismounting only costs you 5 feet of your movement, in place of half.

description.p: Prerequisite: 3rd-level ranger, Rider I

You have special skill at training and riding animals, both wild and domestic. You have advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks to domesticate wild animals, and you can teach a beast to be a trained mount in half the normal time.

sheet.description: You have advantage on Animal Handling checks to domesticate wild animals, and you can teach a beast to be a trained mount in half the normal time.

description.p: Prerequisite: 6th-level ranger, Rider I, II
You are a master of mounted combat. When you are riding your mount and it is hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to become the target of that attack instead.
In addition, when you or your mount are forced to make a Dexterity saving throw, you can use your reaction to grant both you and your mount advantage on the saving throw.

sheet.description: When you are riding your mount and it is hit by an attack, you can become the target of that attack instead.

description.p: Prerequisite: 6th-level ranger
You are especially skilled at navigating the winding tunnels under the earth. You gain darkvision out to a radius of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision its range increases by 60 feet.

In addition, you can use an action on your turn close your eyes and gain tremmorsense in a 60 foot radius, allowing you to sense anything touching the ground within that radius. This special sense lasts for 1 minute, or until you open your eyes. Once you use this action you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

sheet.description: You close your eyes and gain tremmorsense in a 60 foot radius, allowing you to sense anything touching the ground within that radius. This special sense lasts for 1 minute, or until you open your eyes.

description.p: You are familiar with forests, trees, and timber of all kinds. You gain proficiency with woodcarver’s tools, and you have advantage on any Intelligence (Nature) checks to identify, recall information, and construct things from wood.
In addition, when you hit a tree or raw timber with a melee weapon attack, it becomes an automatic critical hit.

sheet.description: You have advantage on any Nature checks to identify, recall information, and construct things from wood. In addition, when you hit a tree or raw timber with a melee weapon attack, it becomes an automatic critical hit.

description.p: Prerequisite: 3rd-level ranger, Woodsman I

You are adept at identifying the strongest trees and timber from which to construct solid objects. You gain proficiency with carpenter’s tools, and anything you construct from wood has twice as many hit points, and is twice as durable.
In addition, at the end of each long rest, if you have timber available, you can craft a total number of clubs, greatclubs, javelins, and quarterstaffs equal to your proficiency bonus.

sheet.description: Anything you construct from wood has twice as many hit points, and is twice as durable. At the end of each long rest, if you have timber available, you can craft a total number of clubs, greatclubs, javelins, and quarterstaffs equal to {{proficiency}}.

description.p: While most rangers specialize in hunting beasts, monsters, and other creatures that threaten civilization, Bounty Hunters protect humanoids from their own. Trained to hunt in urban environments, Bounty Hunters can track their prey through the dark alleyways and underbellies of any town or city. Trained to use various martial techniques, these rangers can confidently confront and subdue any dangerous humanoid.
You have learned a few martial techniques. When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain the following features:

Maneuvers. You learn two maneuvers of your choice from the list at the end of this archetype description. You can use only one maneuver per attack. When you gain a level, you can replace one maneuver you know with another of your choice.

Superiority Dice. You have three superiority dice, which are d6s for you. You must expend a superiority die to use once of your maneuvers. You regain all of your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest.
Saving Throws. Some of your maneuvers require your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver’s effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:
Maneuver save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).
The maneuvers listed below are available to Bounty Hunter rangers, who focus on disabling and restraining their foes.

sheet.description: You have {{superiority-dice:die-count}} superiority dice, which are d{{superiority-dice:die-type}}s. You regain all expended superiority dice at the end of a short or long rest. Your maneuver save DC is {{maneuver:save-dc}}.

description.p: Your line of work requires a discerning ear and a willingness to get comfortable with folks of ill repute. At 3rd level, you gain proficiency in the Investigation skill. Any time you make a Intelligence (Investigation) check in an urban environment you can add double your proficiency bonus to your roll.
In addition, if you spend the night in a settlement, you have advantage on any ability check you make related to gathering contacts, information, or navigating that settlement.

sheet.description: Any time you make a Investigation check in an urban environment you can add double your proficiency bonus to your roll. In addition, if you spend the night in a settlement, you have advantage on any ability check you make related to gathering contacts, information, or navigating that settlement.

description.p: You are skilled at immobilizing your quarries. Beginning at 7th level, whenever you make a Strength (Athletics) check to grapple or shove a creature prone, you gain a bonus to your roll equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1).
In addition, being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn’t impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls with nets.

sheet.description: Whenever you make an Athletics check to grapple or shove a creature prone, you gain a +{{wis-mod:min-one}} bonus to your roll. In addition, being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn’t impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls with nets.

description.p: Your martial skill has improved. At 7th level, you gain an additional superiority die, and all your superiority dice become d8s. You also learn two additional maneuvers of your choice from the list at the end of this archetype.

Upon reaching 15th level, your skills increase even further, rivaling hunters of legend. You gain another superiority die (for a total of five), and your superiority dice become d10s. You also learn two more maneuvers of your choice.

You are a master of disabling dangerous foes. Starting at 11th level, when a Large or smaller creature misses you with a melee weapon attack, you can use your reaction force it to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature falls prone, and if you have a free hand you can attempt to grapple the creature as part of this reaction.

sheet.description: When a Large or smaller creature misses you with a melee weapon attack, you can use your reaction force it to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature falls prone, and if you have a free hand you can attempt to grapple the creature as part of this reaction.

description.p: Your insight into those you hunt is almost supernatural, enabling you to predict attacks and lessen blows. Beginning at 15th level, if you hit a creature with a weapon attack, any time you take damage from that creature until the beginning of your next turn, the damage is reduced by an amount equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1 hit point).

sheet.description: If you hit a creature with a weapon attack, any time you take damage from that creature until the beginning of your next turn, the damage is reduced by {{wis-mod:min-one}}.

description.p: When you make a Dexterity (Stealth) check or roll for initiative, you can expend one superiority die and add it to the roll, provided you aren’t surprised or incapacitated.

sheet.description: When you make a Stealth check or roll for initiative, you can expend one superiority die and add it to the roll, provided you aren’t surprised or incapacitated.

description.p: As a bonus action, you can expend a superiority die, throwing detritus at a creature within 5 feet, forcing them to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes damage equal to your superiority die roll and is blinded until the start of your next turn.

sheet.description: You can expend a superiority die, forcing a creature within 5 feet to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes damage equal to your superiority die roll and is blinded until the start of your next turn.

description.p: When you hit with a creature with an unarmed strike you can expend a superiority die and force them to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is stunned until the start of your next turn.

sheet.description: When you hit with a creature with an unarmed strike you can expend a superiority die and force them to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is stunned until the start of your next turn.

description.p: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend a superiority die to hamper its movement. You add the superiority die to the damage roll, and it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it’s speed is reduced to 0 until the start of your next turn.

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend a superiority die and add the superiority die to the damage roll. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it’s speed is reduced to 0 until the start of your next turn.

description.p: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend a superiority die and target a vulnerable point. You add the superiority die to the attack’s damage roll, and the creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature cannot take reactions and its movement speed is halved until the start of your next turn.

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend a superiority die and target a vulnerable point. You add the superiority die to the attack’s damage roll, and the creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature cannot take reactions and its movement speed is halved until the start of your next turn.

description.p: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to knock the target down. You add the superiority die to the damage roll, and if the target is Large or smaller, it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, you knock the target prone.

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to knock the target down. You add the superiority die to the damage roll, and if the target is Large or smaller, it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, you knock the target prone.

description.p: Sometimes, powerful ancient dragons will call upon a ranger who has proved themselves worthy of draconic power. These rare few are granted the boon of a draconic companion, known as a drake. Drakebound rangers form a mystical bond with their companion that allows them to share in the awe inspiring power of dragons. As their bond deepens, both ranger and drake grow in mystical might and draconic power.

our bond with your drake allows you to understand their language and empowers your presence. At 3rd level you learn to speak, read, and write draconic. You also learn the thaumaturgy cantrip, which is a ranger spell for you.

Starting at 3rd-level, you can use an action to magically summon the drake bound to you. It appears in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet. The drake is friendly to you and your allies and obeys your commands. When you summon the drake, choose its Draconic Essence: acid, cold, fire, lighting, or poison. The chosen type determines the drake’s damage immunity, the damage of its bite, and the damage of its Infused Strikes trait. The drake the Drake Companion stat block, which uses your proficiency bonus (PB) in several places.

In combat, the drake shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes on its turn is the Dodge action, unless you command it to take another action from its stat block as a bonus action. If you are incapacitated, the drake can take any action of its choice.
Once you summon the drake, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher to summon it.

The drake remains for a number of hours equal to your proficiency bonus, until it is reduced to 0 hit points, until you use this feature to summon the drake again, or until you die. Anything the drake was wearing or carrying is left behind when the drake vanishes.

sheet.description: You can magically summon the drake bound to you to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet. When you summon the drake, choose its Draconic Essence: acid, cold, fire, lighting, or poison. The chosen type determines the drake’s damage immunity, the damage of its bite, and the damage of its Infused Strikes trait. The drake remains for up to {{proficiency}} hours.

description.p: The bond you share with your drake grows stronger. Starting at 7th level, while your drake is summoned, you are resistant to the damage type of its Draconic Essence and its bite attack deals an additional 1d6 damage of the same type.
When you summon your drake, you choose if it is a Small or Medium sized, and it gains one of the following traits:
Amphibious. Your drake grows fins that allow it to maneuver easily through the water. It can breathe both air and water, and it gains a swimming speed of 40 feet.
Aerial. Your drake sprouts leathery winds that allow it to soar through the skies. It gains a flying speed of 40 feet.

sheet.description: While your drake is summoned, you are resistant to your it’s Draconic Essence damage type, and the it’s bite attack deals an additional 1d6 Draconic Essence damage. In addition, when you summon your drake, you choose whether it is a Small or Medium creature, and it gains one of the following traits of your choice: your drake takes on aquatic form, or your drake can take to the skies.

description.p: Starting at 11th level, both you and your drake can produce elemental breath attacks. As an action, you, or your drake, can exhale a 30-foot cone of elemental energy. Creatures within the cone must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, they take 6d6 damage of your drake’s Draconic Essence type, and half as much on a success. At 15th level, the damage increases to 8d6.
Once either you, or your drake, use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a spell slot of 3rd-level or higher to use it again.

sheet.description: Either you or your drake can exhale a 30-foot cone of elemental breath. Each creature in the cone must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC {{spellcasting:dc:wis}}. Creatures take {{elemental-breath:damage-dice}}d6 Draconic Essence damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

description.p: The bond between you and your drake has reached the pinnacle of its power. Upon reaching 15th level, when you summon your drake, you choose whether it is Small, Medium, or Large creature. Both you and your drake gain the following benefits while your drake is summoned:

ul.li: Your drake’s bite attack deals an additional 1d6 Draconic Essence damage (for a total of 2d6 extra damage).
When you or your drake takes damage while within 30 feet of the other, you can use your reaction to give yourself or your drake resistance to the damage from that attack.

sheet.description: When you summon your drake, you choose whether it is Small, Medium, or Large creature. Both you and your drake gain the following benefits while your drake is summoned: Your drake’s bite attack deals an additional 1d6 Draconic Essence damage (for a total of 2d6 extra damage). When you or your drake takes damage while within 30 feet of the other, you can use your reaction to give yourself or your drake resistance to the damage from that attack.

setters.set: 5 + five times your ranger level (the drake has a number of hit dice [d10s] equal to your ranger level)

description.p: You add your proficiency bonus to any ability check, attack roll, or saving throw that the drake makes.

sheet.description: You add your proficiency bonus to any ability check, attack roll, or saving throw that the drake makes.

description.p: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d6 +3 piercing damage.

sheet.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d6 +3 piercing damage.

description.p: When the drake, or a creature within 30 feet that the drake can see, hits a creature with a weapon attack, the drake can infuse the strike, causing the attack to deal an extra 1d6 of it’s Draconic Essence damage type.

sheet.description: When the drake, or a creature within 30 feet that the drake can see, hits a creature with a weapon attack, the drake can infuse the strike, causing the attack to deal an extra 1d6 of it’s Draconic Essence damage type.

description.p: Sometimes it takes a monster to destroy a monster. Rangers that take up the mantle of the Grim Warden undergo a blood ritual, known as the Warden’s Rite, to gain enhanced abilities. During this dark alchemical ritual, they sacrifice their very selves, mingling their blood with that of monsters, mutilating themselves in order to gain the power to destroy their foes.

You gain certain spells at the ranger levels noted in the table below. They count as ranger spells for you, you always have them prepared, but they don’t count against the total number of spells you can prepare each day.

At 3rd level, you undergo the Warden’s Rite, an alchemical ritual that suffuses your blood with sinister magic. You gain proficiency in alchemist’s supplies and in the Religion skill. Whenever you make an Intelligence (Religion) check related to fiends or undead you have advantage on the roll.

sheet.description: Whenever you make an Religion check related to fiends or undead you have advantage on the roll.

description.p: Starting at 3rd level, you can draw on the dark magic in your blood to empower your strikes. When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one of your Hit Dice to deal an additional 2d10 necrotic damage to the target.

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one of your Hit Dice to deal an additional 2d10 necrotic damage to the target.

description.p: You can draw on the power in your veins to enhance your physical abilities. Starting at 7th level, when you make a Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution ability check, you can use your reaction to grant yourself a bonus to your roll equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1).
In addition, your movement speed increases by 5 feet.

sheet.description: When you make a Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution ability check, you can use your reaction to grant yourself a +{{wis-mod:min-one}} bonus to your roll.

description.p: Beginning at 11th level, the dark magic in your blood seeps into your weapon strikes. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can deal an additional 1d10 necrotic damage to the target.

sheet.description: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can deal an additional 1d10 necrotic damage to the target.

description.p: Starting at 15th level, you manifest the full potential of the Hunter’s Rite, and you are always under the effects of the protection from good and evil spell.

sheet.description: You are always under the effects of the protection from good and evil spell.

description.p: Nomads delight in travel, exploration, and discovery. They desire to learn all they can, uncovering secrets and hidden lore. They strive to keep their mind in a meditative state that allows them to perceive a strange, living web of knowledge known as the Noosphere. This web links all who follow the way of the Nomad, and allows them to access knowledge and skills from far off places and distant lives.

div.p: For the mechanics to match the fantasy of a ranger who wields psionic power, replace all Wisdom-based class and subclass features with Intelligence.

description.p: You gain certain spells at the ranger levels noted in the Nomad Spells table. They count as ranger spells for you, you always have them prepared, but they don’t count against the total number of spells you can prepare each day.

Starting at 3rd level, you can erase yourself from minds of your foes with a strike. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can force them to make an Intelligence saving throw in addition to the attack’s damage. On a failed save, it takes 1d4 psychic damage, and it cannot perceive you until the start of your next turn.
Starting at 11th level, the psychic damage becomes 2d4.

sheet.description: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can force them to make an Intelligence saving throw in addition to the attack’s damage. On a failed save, it takes {{expunging-strike:damage-dice}}d4 psychic damage, and it cannot perceive you until the start of your next turn.

description.p: When you adopt the Nomad archetype at 3rd level, you gain access to the strange living web of knowledge known as the Noosphere. At the end of each long rest, you gain two skill or tool proficiencies of your choice, which last until the end of your next long rest. You can also choose to learn a language in place of one, or both, proficiencies.

sheet.description: At the end of each long rest, you gain two skill or tool proficiencies of your choice, which last until the end of your next long rest. You can also choose to learn a language in place of one, or both, proficiencies.

description.p: You have begun to become one with the Noosphere. Upon reaching 7th level, you gain resistance to psychic damage.

Also, when you are hit with an attack, you can use your reaction to disappear into the Noosphere, causing the triggering attack to miss. You immediately reappear in an unoccupied space of your choice that you occupied at some point since the starting of your previous turn.
Once you use this reaction you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again, unless you expend a spell slot of 2nd-level or higher to use it again.

sheet.description: When you are hit with an attack, you can use your reaction to disappear into the Noosphere, causing the triggering attack to miss. You immediately reappear in an unoccupied space of your choice that you occupied at some point since the starting of your previous turn.

description.p: Beginning at 11th level, if you have not yet moved on your turn, you can use a bonus action to expend all of your movement and teleport a number of feet equal to double your movement speed to an unoccupied space that you can see.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: If you have not yet moved on your turn, you can use a bonus action to expend all of your movement and teleport {{strange-movement:speed}} feet to an unoccupied space that you can see.

description.p: You have learned to draw psionic energy from the Noosphere to assault your foes. Starting at 15th level, each time you teleport with a Nomadic Magic spell, Memory of One Thousand Steps, or Strange Movement you can force creatures of your choice within 10 feet of the point at which you appear to make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, they 2d8 psychic damage.

sheet.description: Each time you teleport with a Nomadic Magic spell, Memory of One Thousand Steps, or Strange Movement you can force creatures of your choice within 10 feet of the point at which you appear to make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, they 2d8 psychic damage.

description.p: Mortals have always looked to the stars for stories of the past, guidance in the present, and glimpses of the future. Most believe that by reading the motions of the heavenly bodies, one can even change fate. The great constellations, the adder, elephant, hare, stag, and wolf, all tell legendary stories and can even grant mortals a portion of their radiant power.
Each night, Stargazers align their soul with the constellations of the night sky, and draw upon the lights to produce radiant magic and tip the scales of fate.

You gain certain spells at the ranger levels noted in the Stargazer Spells table. They count as ranger spells for you, you always have them prepared, but they don’t count against the total number of spells you can prepare each day.

You are guided by the constellations of the night sky. When you adopt the Stargazer archetype at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with navigators tool, and you cannot become lost, even by magical means, so long as you can see the night sky.

In addition, at the end of each long rest, you can attune yourself to one of the constellations from the Constellation Magic table below. You learn the corresponding cantrip and 1st-level spell, they count as ranger spells for you, but they don’t count against your total number of Spells Known.
You can cast your 1st-level Constellation Spell at 1st-level, without expending a spell slot or components, a number of time equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once)

sheet.description: You cannot become lost, even by magical means, so long as you can see the night sky. At the end of each long rest, you can attune yourself to one of the constellations from the Constellation Magic table. You can cast your 1st-level Constellation Spell at 1st-level, without expending a spell slot or components {{wis-mod:min-one}} times per long rest.

description.p: Your insight into the stars allows you to twist the threads of fate. Starting at 7th level, when you, or a creature that you can see within 30 feet, makes an ability check or saving throw, you can use your reaction to add your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1) to the result of the roll.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When you, or a creature that you can see within 30 feet, makes an ability check or saving throw, you can add {{wis-mod:min-one}} to the result of the roll.

description.p: Starting at 11th level, you can use a bonus action to enter a trance, allowing the celestial bodies of the night sky to guide your strikes. While you are in this trance, your eyes fill with starlight, and once per turn, when you make an attack roll you can treat a roll on the d20 of 9 or lower as a 10.
This trance lasts for 1 minute, unless you choose to end it as a bonus action, or you are incapacitated. Once you use this ability you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

sheet.description: You enter a trance which lasts for up to 1 minute. Once per turn, when you make an attack roll you can treat a roll on the d20 of 9 or lower as a 10.

description.p: Upon reaching 15th level, you have become suffused you with starlight. As a reaction, when a creature that you can see within 30 feet hits you with an attack, you can release a flash of blinding light and force the attacker to make a Constitution saving throw. The attacker takes 2d8 radiant damage and is blinded until the start of its next turn on a failed save, and it takes half damage and is not blinded on a successful save.

sheet.description: When a creature that you can see within 30 feet hits you with an attack, you can release a flash of blinding light and force the attacker to make a Constitution saving throw. The attacker takes 2d8 radiant damage and is blinded until the start of its next turn on a failed save, and it takes half damage and is not blinded on a successful save.

description.p: Gloom Stalkers are at home in the darkest places: deep under the earth, in gloomy alleyways, in primeval forests, and wherever else the light dims. Most folk enter such places with trepidation, but a Gloom Stalker ventures boldly into the darkness, seeking to ambush threats before they can reach the broader world. Such rangers are often found in the Underdark, but they will go any place where evil lurks in the shadows.

sheet.description: Gloom Stalkers are at home in the darkest places: deep under the earth, in gloomy alleyways, in primeval forests, and wherever else the light dims.

description.p: Replacement 3rd-level Gloom Stalker feature

You gain certain spells at the ranger levels noted in the Gloom Stalker Spells table. They count as ranger spells for you, you always have them prepared, but they don’t count against the total number of spells you can prepare each day.

Horizon Walkers guard the world against threats that originate from other planes or that seek to ravage the mortal realm with otherworldly magic. They seek out planar portals and keep watch over them, venturing to the Inner Planes and the Outer Planes as needed to pursue their foes. These rangers are also friends to any forces in the multiverse-especially benevolent dragons, fey, and elementals-that work to preserve life and the order of the planes.

sheet.description: Horizon Walkers guard the world against threats that originate from other planes or that seek to ravage the mortal realm with otherworldly magic.

description.p: Replacement 3rd-level Horizon Walker feature

You gain certain spells at the ranger levels noted in the Horizon Walker Spells table. They count as ranger spells for you, you always have them prepared, but they don’t count against the total number of spells you can prepare each day.

td.em: alarm, protection from evil and good

description.p: You have dedicated yourself to hunting down creatures of the night and wielders of grim magic. A Monster Slayer seeks out vampires, dragons, evil fey, fiends, and other magical threats. Trained in supernatural techniques to overcome such monsters, Slayers are experts at unearthing and defeating mighty, mystical foes.

sheet.description: You have dedicated yourself to hunting down creatures of the night and wielders of grim magic.

description.p: Replacement 3rd-level Monster Slayer feature

You gain certain spells at the ranger levels noted in the Monster Slayer Spells table. They count as ranger spells for you, you always have them prepared, but they don’t count against the total number of spells you can prepare each day.

td.em: compelled duel, protectionfrom evil and good
dispel evil and good, hold monster

description.p: A fey mystique surrounds you, thanks to the boon of an archfey, the shining fruit you ate from a talking tree, the magic spring you swam in, or some other auspicious event. However you acquired your fey magic, you are now a Fey Wanderer, a ranger who represents both the mortal and the fey realms. As you wander the multiverse, your joyful laughter brightens the hearts of the downtrodden, and your martial prowess strikes terror in your foes, for great is the mirth of the fey and dreadful is their fury.
Replacement 3rd-level Fey Wanderer feature

You gain certain spells at the ranger levels noted in the Fey Wanderer Spells table. They count as ranger spells for you, you always have them prepared, but they don’t count against the total number of spells you can prepare each day.
You also possess a preternatural blessing from a fey ally or a place of fey power. Choose your blessing from the Feywild Gifts table or determine it randomly.

tr.td: Illusory butterflies flutter around you while you take a short or long rest.
Fresh, seasonal flowers sprout from your hair each dawn.
You faintly smell of cinnamon, lavender, nutmeg, or another comforting herb or spice.
Your shadow dances while no one is looking directly at it.
Horns or antlers sprout from your head.
Your skin and hair change color to match the season at each dawn.

description.p: Feeling a deep connection to the environment around them, some rangers reach out through their magical connection to the world and bond with a swarm of nature spirits. The swarm becomes a potent force in battle, as well as helpful company for the ranger. Some Swarmkeepers are outcasts or hermits, keeping to themselves and their attendant swarms rather than dealing with the discomfort of others. Other Swarmkeepers enjoy building vibrant communities that work for the mutual benefit of all those they consider part of their swarm.
Replacement 3rd-level Swarmkeeper feature

You gain certain spells at the ranger levels noted in the Swarmkeeper Spells table. They count as ranger spells for you, you always have them prepared, but they don’t count against the total number of spells you can prepare each day.
